passage_text: As of January 2013, D-banded TSOs receive annual salaries of between $25,518 and $38,277, while E-banded officers are paid between $29,302 and $44,007. These salary bands do not include the additional locality pay that TSA employees working in high-cost areas are eligible to receive.

For many Chief Risk Officers, more experience generally translates to higher pay. Chief Risk Officers in the early stages of their careers take home approximately $137K on average. The average for people in the five-to-10 year group is only a little larger at $150K.

(United States). For Chief Risk Officers, yearly average wages total $163K annually. With some bonuses approaching $92K and certain profit sharing proceeds approaching $49K, overall incomes of Chief Risk Officers spread between $99K and $321K depending on individual performance.

For example the median expected annual pay for a typical Credit Risk Officer I in the United States is $61,329, so 50% of the people who perform the job of Credit Risk Officer I in the United States are expected to make less than $61,329. Source: HR Reported data as of October 2015. 1  Salary. 2  Salary + Bonus. 3  Benefits.

According to the BLS, the median annual salary for compliance officers was $64,340 in 2013, but there can be wide differences in wages depending on a job’s educational, scientific and work-experience requirements. The best-paid 10 percent in the field earned $99,450 in 2013, while the lowest-paid made $36,720.
